poem:
Title: "Twilight Choreography of a Sudden Change"

In efforts of economy,
we danced with Chance and Time,
our steps etching promises
in the ledger.

Yet, this morning's paper raise
old ghosts of the wild west, pensions,
whispering changes in the age-old tune -
A discordant ballet of print and pound.

We've waltzed with uncertainty
to a rhythm we may not afford,
In the choreography of twilight's unwelcome encore.
